cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles ESE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west, forecast to bend WNW–NW across the Yucatan Peninsula Saturday night, then track north-northwest across the south-central Gulf toward the northwest Gulf Coast (TX-LA) early next week

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: None at this time (future watches possible for the Yucatan Peninsula and U.S. Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Honduras/Nicaragua border westward to Punta Castilla, Bay Islands of Honduras, and Puerto Cabezas Nicaragua northward to the border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Nicaragua & Honduras Friday, Yucatan Peninsula Saturday, northern Gulf Coast (TX-LA-MS) early next week
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤5%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds reaching the port late Monday night into Tuesday; breezy conditions otherwise.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the inland port; minor surge possible farther south along the lower Mississippi Delta.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands associated with MARCO could bring 2–4 inches of rain with locally higher totals Tuesday–Wednesday if the track trends closer to Louisiana.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential temporary river level rise on the Mississippi, port readiness restrictions and vessel traffic control beginning late Monday.
